p: Essential oils from the dried aerial parts (leaves, stalks, flowers; 4.3 kg) or roots (1.8 kg) of C. cernuum were obtained by hydrodistillation using a Clevenger-type apparatus. The process was conducted for 5 h using 100–550 g of plant material. The yellowish essential oils of specific strong odor were dried over anhydrous magnesium sulphate, and stored at 4 °C in the dark, until tested and analyzed.
